column4: sudo apt-get install glib doesnt worrk. anyone know why? If I know that a name contains somethiing can I install it by doing apt-get.... *bleh* ?
it's always good to do a search so you know which packages to install.  You can search with synaptic, or apt-cache search <searchterm>
i do i think.  its just i tried to install gaim beta 3 though apt and apt got rid of ubuntu-desktop :S
oh actually it was dpkg i used first but then it failed due to a dep so i had to do apt-get -f install, which got rid of it
http://mighmos.org/packages.php thats where i got the file from
okay, that's not an official repo, as you're probably aware
yeah, i was going to build it myself but somethings up with my GTK, which causes some kind of syntax error when configure tries to build the test program
you have the proper -dev libraries instaleld?
yeah i think so, apt-get install libgtk-dev and such kept saying that its the newest version
you'll have to use sudo, of coursse
